intro: Peucedanum lancifoliolum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often hollow stems. The plant features finely divided, lance-shaped leaves and small white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its historical use in traditional medicine is noted for its potential digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
